title: Drawing, Villa Farnese: in the Moat of Caprarola, ca. 1813
title_raw: Villa Farnese: in the Moat of Caprarola
medium: Black chalk, pen and black ink, brush and brown watercolor on cream laid paper
markings: In purple ink, upper right: Cooper Union stamp: MUSEUM / FOR THE / ARTS OF / DECORATION / COOPER UNION (Lugt 457c)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description:
View of bridge over water, in center, leading to classical building on left; figures walking across bridge. Two figures at right walking with bundles/baskets on heads. In margin, caption: 9; Caprarola
On verso, in black ink, allover designs of wall decorations and paintings: Decorated pilaster, wall panels, entablature and vaulted ceiling; below is a dado, with frames, a cargo boat, figures.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Villa Farnese: in the Moat of Caprarola, ca. 1813. Black chalk, pen and black ink, brush and brown watercolor on cream laid paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2085
